abstracts.cdata!:
The Road Sector Program Support Project
            for Moldova had an overall moderately satisfactory outcome,
            with the performances of the Bank and the borrower being
            deemed moderately satisfactory as well. All three project
            development outcome indicators were achieved, as were the
            seven intermediate outcome indicators. Significant lessons
            learned during project implementation include: 1) more
            resolute, up-front action could have been taken to counter
            the political interference which led to mis-procurement; 2)
            relatively modest investment funding can be used to leverage
            other external resources with a programmatic approach; 3)
            coordination with development agencies can make operations
            more efficient and have a greater development impact; 4) the
            Bank can differentiate itself from other development
            agencies through its expertise on institutional and policy
            reform; and 5) project outcome indicators should be limited
            in time and scope, and should measure results which can be
            influenced by the Bank.
